events.originalText: Fifty minutes after departing Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, Air Algérie Flight 5017 disappeared from radar; its wreckage was found the next day in Mali, with no survivors of the 116 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Ouagadougou
events.headline: Air Algérie Flight 5017 disappears in Mali, no survivors found

events.originalText: MV Arctic Sea, declared to be carrying a cargo of timber, was allegedly boarded by hijackers off the coast of Sweden in an incident that remains incompletely explained.
events.subtitle: MV Arctic Sea
events.headline: MV Arctic Sea boarded by hijackers off coast of Sweden

events.originalText: A gunman entered the United States Capitol and opened fire, killing two police officers.
events.subtitle: United States Capitol
events.headline: Gunman kills two police officers in United States Capitol

events.originalText: Iran–Iraq War: In opposition to the American plan to protect Kuwaiti tankers, Iran laid mines and damaged the SS Bridgeton, resulting in a propaganda victory for Iran.
events.subtitle: Iran–Iraq War
events.headline: Iran damages SS Bridgeton in opposition to American plan

events.originalText: The Australian swimming team, nicknamed the Quietly Confident Quartet, won the men's 4 × 100 metre medley relay at the Moscow Olympics.
events.subtitle: Quietly Confident Quartet
events.headline: Australian swimming team wins men's relay at Moscow Olympics

events.originalText: Following the collapse of the Greek military junta, the Metapolitefsi period began as the country transitioned to a democratic government.
events.subtitle: Greek junta
events.headline: Greek military junta collapses, Metapolitefsi period begins

events.originalText: During a speech in Montreal, French president Charles de Gaulle (pictured) declared "Long live free Quebec!", a statement that was interpreted as support for Quebec independence from Canada.
events.subtitle: Montreal
events.headline: French president de Gaulle declares support for Quebec independence

events.originalText: Soviet premier Nikita Khrushchev and U.S. vice president Richard Nixon held an impromptu debate (pictured) at the opening of the American National Exhibition at Sokolniki Park in Moscow.
events.subtitle: Nikita Khrushchev
events.headline: Khrushchev and Nixon hold impromptu debate in Moscow

events.originalText: The Treaty of Lausanne was signed to settle part of the partition of the Ottoman Empire, establishing the boundaries of Greece, Bulgaria and Turkey.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Lausanne
events.headline: Treaty of Lausanne signed to settle Ottoman Empire partition

events.originalText: Franco-Syrian War: At the Battle of Maysalun forces of the Arab Kingdom of Syria were defeated by a French army moving to occupy the territory allocated to them by the San Remo conference.
events.subtitle: Franco-Syrian War
events.headline: French army defeats Arab Kingdom of Syria at Battle of Maysalun

events.originalText: Mary, Queen of Scots, was forced to abdicate in favour of her one-year-old son, James VI.
events.subtitle: Mary, Queen of Scots
events.headline: Mary, Queen of Scots forced to abdicate in favor of son

events.originalText: Scottish clansmen led by Donald of Islay, Lord of the Isles, and Alexander Stewart, Earl of Mar, fought the Battle of Harlaw (monument pictured) near Inverurie, Scotland.
events.subtitle: Scottish clan
events.headline: Scottish clansmen fight Battle of Harlaw near Inverurie
